definitions.text: send out real or metaphoric rays
extend or spread outward from a center or focus or inward towards a center
examples: spokes radiate from the hub of the wheel
This plants radiate spines in all directions

definitions.text: have a complexion with a strong bright color, such as red or pink
examples: Her face glowed when she came out of the sauna

definitions.text: cause to be seen by emitting light as if in rays
experience a feeling of well-being or happiness, as from good health or an intense emotion
issue or emerge in rays or waves
examples: Heat radiated from the metal box

definitions.text: spread into new habitats and produce variety or variegate
examples: The plants on this island diversified

definitions.text: arranged like rays or radii; radiating from a common center
examples: a starlike or stellate arrangement of petals
many cities show a radial pattern of main highways

definitions.text: having rays or ray-like parts as in the flower heads of daisies
